text: The Golden State Warriors capped off the 2024-25 regular season with a 48-34 record, securing the seventh seed in the Western Conference.After knocking out the Houston Rockets in the first round of the playoffs, Golden Stateâ€™s season ended with a 1-4 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference semifinals, an exit hastened by Stephen Curryâ€™s injury in Game 1 that sidelined him for the remainder of the series.Â While Curry and the Warriors deal with their struggles on the court, off the court, Steph's wife, Ayesha Curry, has continued to expand her footprint as a multifaceted entrepreneur, chef, author and media personality.Â On Monday, Ayesha, with her ever-growing follower base, posted a series of family photos on Instagram.Â She captioned the post, "Grateful."Fans immediately reacted, flooding the post with comments."I love the Curryâ€™s â¤ï¸ğŸ‘," one user wrote."Curry and his family ğŸ™‚â€â†”ï¸ ya all got 4 rings more to comeğŸ«©â€”â€”>," anotherÂ wrote."my favorite coupleğŸ¥°," one userÂ wrote.Â "A Very Beautiful NBA Family ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥â¤ï¸â¤ï¸," another fanÂ wrote."my favorite familyâ¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸," one userÂ wrote.Â "blessed life â¤ï¸," another fanÂ wrote.Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry next to his wife Ayesha.Cary Edmondson-Imagn ImagesSteph enjoyed another historic season individually before his playoff injury, averagingÂ 24.5 points, 6.0 assists and 4.4 rebounds per game on 44.8% shooting from the field, 39.7% from deep and 93.3% from the free-throw line during the regular season.Â His play earned him an 11th NBA All-Star nod, a second-team All-NBA selection and the 2025 NBA All-Star MVP.Â Steph and Ayesha have been married since 2011 and have four children: daughters Riley and Ryan and sons Canon and Caius. html:
The Golden State Warriors capped off the 2024-25 regular season with a 48-34 record, securing the seventh seed in the Western Conference.

After knocking out the Houston Rockets in the first round of the playoffs, Golden Stateâ€™s season ended with a 1-4 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference semifinals, an exit hastened by Stephen Curryâ€™s injury in Game 1 that sidelined him for the remainder of the series.Â 

While Curry and the Warriors deal with their struggles on the court, off the court, Steph's wife, Ayesha Curry, has continued to expand her footprint as a multifaceted entrepreneur, chef, author and media personality.Â 

On Monday, Ayesha, with her ever-growing follower base, posted a series of family photos on Instagram.Â She captioned the post, "Grateful."

Fans immediately reacted, flooding the post with comments.

"I love the Curryâ€™s â¤ï¸ğŸ‘," one user wrote.

"my favorite familyâ¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸," one userÂ wrote.Â 

"blessed life â¤ï¸," another fanÂ wrote.

Steph enjoyed another historic season individually before his playoff injury, averagingÂ 24.5 points, 6.0 assists and 4.4 rebounds per game on 44.8% shooting from the field, 39.7% from deep and 93.3% from the free-throw line during the regular season.Â 

His play earned him an 11th NBA All-Star nod, a second-team All-NBA selection and the 2025 NBA All-Star MVP.Â 

Steph and Ayesha have been married since 2011 and have four children: daughters Riley and Ryan and sons Canon and Caius. All four were featured in Ayesha's post on Monday.
